newsitem.title: USA: U.S. aluminum service center shipments off Jan-Jul.
newsitem.headline: U.S. aluminum service center shipments off Jan-Jul.

text.p: U.S. aluminum service center shipments fell 3.6 percent in the first seven months of the year compared to the same period in 1995, National Association of Aluminum Distributors reported.
Some service center officials noted that customers were taking a day-to-day approach following a steady decline in prices since the start of the year. Orders are being place on an as-needed basis.
Others said the lengthening in delivery times at producers may signal an end to the slide in mill pricing.
According to the NAAD's three-month moving average, the shipment index rose to 135.1 points in July - the highest since February - and up from 134.9 points in June.
The inventory index fell to 124.2 points in July from 124.8 in June. Inventory stood at 2.9 months of metal in July, unchanged from June.
